remarks: The topology generated by a neighborhood base is unique.  (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 16-Sep-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Sep-2015.)
statement:
neibastop1.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
neibastop1.2 $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> ( ~P ~P X \ { (/) } ) ) $.
neibastop1.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ v e. ( F ` x ) /\ w e. ( F ` x ) ) ) -> ( ( F ` x ) i^i ~P ( v i^i w ) ) =/= (/) ) $.
neibastop1.4 $e |- J = { o e. ~P X | A. x e. o ( ( F ` x ) i^i ~P o ) =/= (/) } $.
neibastop1.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ v e. ( F ` x ) ) ) -> x e. v ) $.
neibastop1.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ v e. ( F ` x ) ) ) -> E. t e. ( F ` x ) A. y e. t ( ( F ` y ) i^i ~P v ) =/= (/) ) $.
neibastop3 $p |- ( ph -> E! j e. ( TopOn ` X ) A. x e. X ( ( nei ` j ) ` { x } ) = { n e. ~P X | ( ( F ` x ) i^i ~P n ) =/= (/) } ) $.
$d F j n o t v w x y $.
$d J j n v x y $.
$d X j n o t v w x y $.
$d j n o ph t v w x y $.
$d n t v y $.
$d n x y $.
$d o t v w x y $.
$d o t v w x y $.
$d o t v x y $.
